title: Business & Finance
text:
Powell said the Fed's resolve in combating the highest inflation in 40 years shouldn't be questioned, even if it requires pushing up unemployment.

---

One of Allianz 's U.S. investing divisions pleaded guilty to securities fraud and agreed to pay about $6 billion in penalties and restitution to investors.

---

Musk said his $44 billion purchase of Twitter can't proceed until the company is clearer about how many of its accounts are fake.

---

U.S. stocks rallied, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow climbing 2%, 2.8% and 1.3%, respectively.

---

Walmart said sales increased in the most recent quarter but that higher costs ate into profit.

---

Directors who control the board of Cerebral agreed on a plan to replace CEO Robertson, sparking leadership tumult at the mental-health startup.

---

JPMorgan shareholders objected to a roughly $50 million retention bonus for Dimon and voted against the bank's compensation plan.

---

Gerber owner Nestle said it would fly extra baby formula into the U.S.
